an10.5:4.1: There Venerable Ānanda addressed the mendicants …
an10.5:4.2: “Reverends, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for having no regrets.
an10.5:4.3: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for gladness.
an10.5:4.4: When there is no gladness, one who lacks gladness has destroyed a vital condition for rapture.
an10.5:4.5: When there is no rapture, one who lacks rapture has destroyed a vital condition for tranquillity.
an10.5:4.6: When there is no tranquillity, one who lacks tranquillity has destroyed a vital condition for bliss.
an10.5:4.7: When there is no bliss, one who lacks bliss has destroyed a vital condition for right samādhi.
an10.5:4.8: When there is no right samādhi, one who lacks right samādhi has destroyed a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an10.5:4.9: When there is no true knowledge and vision, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
an10.5:4.10: When there is no disillusionment and dispassion, one who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an10.5:4.11: Suppose there was a tree that lacked branches and foliage.
an10.5:4.12: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would not grow to fullness.
an10.5:4.15: In the same way, an unethical person, who lacks ethics, has destroyed a vital condition for having no regrets.
an10.5:4.16: When there are regrets, one who has regrets has destroyed a vital condition for gladness. …
an10.5:4.17: One who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an10.5:5.1: An ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
an10.5:5.2: When there are no regrets, one who has no regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for gladness.
an10.5:5.3: When there is gladness, one who has fulfilled gladness has fulfilled a vital condition for rapture.
an10.5:5.4: When there is rapture, one who has fulfilled rapture has fulfilled a vital condition for tranquillity.
an10.5:5.5: When there is tranquillity, one who has fulfilled tranquillity has fulfilled a vital condition for bliss.
an10.5:5.6: When there is bliss, one who has fulfilled bliss has fulfilled a vital condition for right samādhi.
an10.5:5.7: When there is right samādhi, one who has fulfilled right samādhi has fulfilled a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an10.5:5.8: When there is true knowledge and vision, one who has fulfilled true knowledge and vision has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
an10.5:5.9: When there is disillusionment and dispassion, one who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an10.5:5.10: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage.
an10.5:5.11: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would grow to fullness.
an10.5:5.14: In the same way, an ethical person, who has fulfilled ethics, has fulfilled a vital condition for not having regrets.
an10.5:5.15: When there are no regrets, one who has no regrets has fulfilled a vital condition for gladness. …
an10.5:5.16: One who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.”
